body_html:
@gunan If I simply do
pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-1.4.0-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl
then it is installing (however without numpy), but I did
pip install numpy
I am getting requirement already satisfied.
But if I do
pip install numpy --upgrade
I am getting that exception again
I think I am not able to retrieve the latest version of numpy package.
My numpy version is '1.13.3' Can I use this with the latest version of tensorflow 1.4.0?

body:
@gunan If I simply do 
`pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-1.4.0-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl`
then it is installing (however without numpy), but I did 
`pip install numpy`
I am getting requirement already satisfied. 
But if I do 
`pip install numpy --upgrade`
I am getting that exception again
I think I am not able to retrieve the latest version of numpy package.
My numpy version is '1.13.3' Can I use this with the latest version of tensorflow 1.4.0?
